page.title: 18Elderly people's home (2).
page.content: Some have families who visit them, or some may go home for the day. Others may need to visit the day hospitals. Once a week residents go to the {Bristol 600 club,}where they do craft. The residents receive Â£10.00 a week from the social services. However if a person has over Â£3000 they use their own money. Old people can be difficult. Some have no memory at all. Miss Rennolds lived in Bedminster with her sister. She does not like the home and would prefer her independance. She came to the home because her sister was no longer able to cope with her. Some times she gets confused and talks to her sister when she is not actually there. Mr Robbins is 102 yrs.old. He worked for British Aerospace. He sometimes loses his way around the home, but he is, like others, happy.
